instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
I have seen this on a few boards now.  Intermittent back light.  I have one on the bench now. 
My plan is to just shotgun but wondered what others have done about this.

When it fails the LED voltage is 17-20v and is slowly fading away.  

Has anyone else fought this one?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
Maybe bad LCD connector.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?
Check XW7720 integrity.
Could also be bad solders at <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>; especially FB ball.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
The intermittent is't physical.  I tested on bench with my known good display.  It worked.  Installed board and it didn't.  Tested again on bench and it didn't work. Then it worked. 
<CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> looked good "perfect" looking under it. I checked all the sides with the scope.   There is no water damage on the back side of the board.   Via is good no corrosion damage.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Intermittent back light)
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Intermittent back light)
threads.message: Could be bad driver. Also make sure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> isn?t getting messed up by a corroded DC-in board/ cable
